         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. Subdivision 1 of section 175-b of the town law, as amended
    2  by chapter 401 of the laws of 1996, is amended to read as follows:
    3    1. The board of fire commissioners of any fire district in which offi-
    4  cers are elected, [may]  SHALL,  by  resolution,  provide  for  absentee

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S1672

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the town law, in relation to absentee ballots for fire district
elections

PURPOSE:
To require absentee ballots for fire district elections.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
Amends section 175-b of the Town Law.

JUSTIFICATION:
Currently the law allows fire districts to use absentee ballots at
local option. This legislation would require fire districts to
provide absentee ballots for fire district elections. This would
ensure that every taxpayer has an equal opportunity to have their
voice heard regarding matters pertaining to fire districts.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
S.6601-A, 2005-06; S.4300, 2007-08; S.4193 2009-10;

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect immediately.
